fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-37216].
  {panel}

Currently in Confluence when a page is delete it is placed into the local Space's Trash.   Then as an administrator I go back into the trashes and have no idea what was deleted recently and what has been there for some time.

As a workaround I have created the following process with the CLI And this would be A LOT easier if only when a page was sent to the trash it was dated on when that happened, even as simple as touch the updated time.

Create a Trash date database
For each space:
    For each item in the trash:
            Get the ID
            Does ID exist in trashDB?
            then
                  Is Date of item in TrashDB > 30 days?
                  then
                          remove ID from Trash DB and Confluence 
                 else
                          Do nothing
             else
                    Add the ID along with a current timestamp to Trash DB
fields.summary: The Trash contents remain forever in confluence and there is no way to determine age of trash

fields.description:
If I upload a word that is bigger than the attachment size limit as a *normal user*, I get an error 'not permitted'. With this error message, a user cannot see that the file size limit has breached.

If I upload a word that is bigger that the attachment size limit as a *confluence-administrator*, I get an understandable error message telling me that the file size limit has breached.

Why is this the case and how can I fix this quickly? Every user should get an appropriate / understandable error message instead of misleading messages.
fields.summary: Misleading Message on Word Import for non-confluence-admins

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-37210].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
The header bar hides the Create button on small screens.

When using Confluence in a smaller browser window, the Create button is pushed behind other items in the header:

!https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/157669/Screen%20Shot%202015-04-14%20at%2011.43.34%20am.png|width=500!

When trying to click it, the Feedback link is given preference:

!https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/157770/Screen%20Shot%202015-04-14%20at%2011.43.44%20am.png|width=500!

I've also seen it end up on the other side of quick search:

!https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/157771/Screen%20Shot%202015-04-14%20at%2011.44.32%20am.png|width=500!

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Log in to Confluence
# Manipulate your screen resolution or browser window size to make it smaller

h3. Expected Results
The Create button should be arranged in a way that is displayed in multiple screen resolutions. 

h3. Actual Results
The screen is rendered in a way that is hidden.


h3.Workaround
Make the browser window larger or higher screen resolution
fields.summary: Header bar hides the Create button on small screens

Steps to replicate:

fields.description:
If an image from a different page is displayed in a page, and the page where the image is attached contains an apostrophe in the page title, upon taking a XML backup and restoring it, the image macro will display a _Unknown Attachment_ error.

This is caused because the apostrophe in the page title in the macro parameters has changed to:
{noformat}’{noformat}

Repro steps:
# Create a personal space.
# Default home page is created with the title: _User Name’s Home_
# Attach an image to the home page.
# Create a new page in another space.
# In the new page, insert the image from _User Name’s Home_. The generated XHTML is:
{noformat}<ri:attachment ri:filename="filename.png"><ri:page ri:content-title="User Name's Home" ri:space-key="~username" /></ri:attachment></ac:image>{noformat}
# Take a XML backup
# Restore the XML backup
# Go to the page created in step #4. _Unknown Attachment_ is displayed instead of the image. The cause is that the apostrophe in the page name in the image macro parameter has been change to {{’}} and the page cannot be found. The XHTML for the page is:
{noformat}<ri:attachment ri:filename="filename.png"><ri:page ri:content-title="User Name’s Home" ri:space-key="~username" /></ri:attachment></ac:image>{noformat}

This could also affect other macros and other characters which are reserved XML characters.
fields.summary: Apostrophes in image macro parameters value do not survive a backup restore

When select a label in a page, all content in active space is listed with the selected label.
It should be usefull to have an option to switch without the filter for the Space selected and use Global labels.
Example:

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-37191].
  {panel}

Starting with Confluence 5.7 displaying recently updated attachements, links the file name with the new file preview, which is OK for supported previewable file types.
It does not make sense to link a non-previewable attachment with a preview functions. This should be downloaded on first click.
Therefore I suggest either
* (1) a filter only linking previewable files for preview and all others for download or
* (2) adding a (optional) filter to the macro to generate a preview link, a download link or both.
fields.summary: Recently Updated Macro renders preview link for all attachments

fields.description:
If your JIRA instance is using a context path add 5 individual JIRA macro issues are added into a Confluence page the context path will be removed from the links.

h4. Steps to reproduce:
# Set up a Confluence 5.5 and a JIRA 6.2 with context path (/confluence and /jira respectively) 
# Link Both applications.
# Now add 4 JIRA issues into a confluence page:
!jmi1.png|thumbnail!
# You will see that those links are working correctly.
# Add a fifth issue.
# Notice that the context path "/jira" was removed from all the links.
!jmi2.png|thumbnail!
# If you remove the fifth issue the context path gets added back again.

h4. Resolution
This BUG is affecting the AppLinks plugin 4.1, to fix this issue you will need to upgrade to Confluence 5.6 (or latest) since after version 5.5. we bundled a new version of the  AppLinks plugin where this issue is fixed.
fields.summary: Adding 5 individual JIRA macro issues removes the context path from the issues link

To whom it may concern.

When creating an article in Confluence and tabbing specific users to receive the article using the @ sign, when received via Outlook, the email has any numbered points out of sync.

This is what I did in Confluence:-
I have created in Confluence a Sales and Marketing space for us to upload all Sales and Marketing materials that sales can use to inform our customers about the Modernisation Project at Automate.
This is first Info Graphic we have created, which is a high-level introduction to Modernisation.
Talking points on this Info Graphic are:-
Evolve 2.0 is coming
What is Evolve 2.0?
Evolve 2.0 is the Next Generation Evolve DMS system and will become our flagship product in the future.
What will Evolve 2.0 offer our customers:-
Evolve 2.0 embraces the following key initiatives:-
A new leading edge technology platform will be introducing, using the latest Progress Technologies.
The current Evolve User Interface (Screens) will be replaced over time, with a revamped modern looking User Interface (UI).
Increased Customer Value:-
BH Automotive have listened to our customers and are making great strides to address their requests and pain points in the existing Evolve System.
Subsequent Evolve releases, will start to address these pain points, based on the new Evolve technology Platform.
As opposed to replacing the entire Evolve system in one go, this will be done in a gradual incremental approach, thus minimising the impact to our customers and their staff.
Enhanced Capability:-
The new technology platforms enables access to integration with: Mobility, 3rd Party Integration, quicker product development, faster turnaround times and thereby enhances our customers capability to compete in the DMS market.
The bottom headings in the Info Graphic, talk to the following points:-
In summary, what this means to our customers is:-
Our new technology components means we are future proofing our DMS to compete globally.
Our UI will become intuitive and easy to use.
The platform will offer improved performance to our customers.
Allow Automate to Innovate and bring products, services and enhancements to our end-end application offering much quicker to market.
NB!
This is the first of around four Info Graphics. The basic idea is for each Info Graphic to build on the previous one. The basic format for the Info Graphics at this stage is:-
Info Graphic:1 - Introduction to Modernisation.
Info Graphic:2 - Explain our Modernisation Program to our customers and what it means to them.
Info Graphic:3 - Explain the rationale for the first changes that will be in the July Release.

fields.description:
*expected behavior:* publish button can be clicked on all of its area under all circumstances.

*current behavior:* the tooltip ("ctrl+s...") is triggered in the upper part of the button (see shot). If the mouse is placed in this area, the tooltip pops out and covers the part of the button so that it can't be clicked. mouse has to be moved below.

It seems to be an issue with positioning not accounting for font size - if the font/zoom is reduced in browser, the tooltip is one-line - which fits above the button.

when the (text only) zoom is increased 2 steps, it still renders the tooltip 2-line, but correctly positioned.
fields.summary: tooltip can fold and obscure "Publish" button click in editor

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-37170].
  {panel}

Firstly, apologies if this has already been raised - I hunted around but found nothing on this.

All our teams really love HipChat integration with Confluence but we are receiving more and more requests for notifications in hipchat rooms at confluence parent and child page level NOT space level. 

Our users are complaining about unnecessary 'noise' in hipchat rooms when pages are created relating to something completely irrelevant to the hipchat room just because the content lives in the same space

As a basic example, we have hc rooms dedicated to particular systems we use i.e. Jenkins, Git, Confluence and JIRA however in some instances all this information lives within one particular confluence space ie. Engineering Tools. Users of one specialist room don't have much interest in content created about a subject that is not related to the room they are in.

Space level notifications are great for wide ranging hc rooms s however the more focused the hc room should allow for a more focused integration with confluence pages. 

Any plans to allow us to select the integration between hc and confluence at a parent page or single page level?  We'd love to see this happen!
fields.summary: HipChat + Confluence integration - Allow post notifications from parent page level not just space level

fields.description:
h6. Steps to reproduce:
Create a page in Confluence with the following contents:
# Line 1:
{code}
<ac:structured-macro ac:name="code">  <ac:plain-text-body><![CDATA[this is my code]]></ac:plain-text-body></ac:structured-macro>
{code}
# Line 2:
{code}
<ac:structured-macro ac:name="code">  <ac:plain-text-body><![CDATA[this is my code]]></ac:plain-text-body></ac:structured-macro>
{code}
Test for Line2
# Line 3:
{code}
<ac:structured-macro ac:name="code">  <ac:plain-text-body><![CDATA[this is my code]]></ac:plain-text-body></ac:structured-macro>
{code}
Place the cursor at the end of the "test for Line2" and press enter and then save the page.

h6. Actual behavior:
When you save the page, the enter after the "Test for Line2" doesn't show.

h6. Expected behavior:
Confluence should respect the changes and show the enter.

h6. Workaround:

Type a dummy word or blank space after pressing enter and then save the page and edit again and remove it.

fields.description:
h3. Symptom

Comment form becomes small in width when using an User Macro which includes <div> tag, as attached CommentForm.jpg.

h3. How to reproduce

# Install vanilla Confluence 5.7.1 (the latest version at this moment)
# Create an User Macro as described in [the last comment of pagebreak user macro page|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DISC/pagebreak+user+macro?focusedCommentId=376835421#comment-376835421] (I used it instead of the direction in the main content of the page, because it is deprecated.)
# Create a page and add the macro in it
# Comment form becomes small in width

h3. Workaround

The problem does not happen when using "PDF Pagebreak" macro provided by [PDF Macros for Confluence|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.tngtech.confluence.plugins.pdfmacros] instead.
(!) Please be noted that it is one of third party add-ons, which Atlassian do not officially support
fields.summary: Comment form becomes small in width when using an User Macro which includes <div> tag

fields.description:
While trying to render notifications for page edits, PageEditedPayloadTransformer can get NullPointerExceptions while calling getOriginalId. This is because the PageEditedEvent is not required to contain the original page id - it can be null. The code needs to not implicitly cast a Long to a long, since that's causing the null pointer exception in this case.

Example stack trace:
{noformat}
2015-04-08 11:35:19,868 ERROR [AtlassianEvent::CustomizableThreadFactory-4] [confluence.notifications.impl.NotificationsEventDispatcher] errorOrDebug Error during notification dispatch : null
 -- referer: http://localhost:1990/confluence/admin/viewplugins.action | url: /confluence/admin/olduploadplugin.action | userName: admin | action: olduploadplugin
java.lang.NullPointerException
  at com.atlassian.confluence.notifications.content.transformer.PageEditedPayloadTransformer.getOriginalId(PageEditedPayloadTransformer.java:20)
  at com.atlassian.confluence.notifications.content.transformer.PageEditedPayloadTransformer.getOriginalId(PageEditedPayloadTransformer.java:12)
  at com.atlassian.confluence.notifications.content.ContentEditedPayloadTransformer.checkedCreate(ContentEditedPayloadTransformer.java:12)
  at com.atlassian.confluence.notifications.PayloadTransformerTemplate.create(PayloadTransformerTemplate.java:38)
  at com.atlassian.confluence.notifications.impl.NotificationsEventDispatcher.handleEventInternal(NotificationsEventDispatcher.java:87)
  at com.atlassian.confluence.notifications.impl.NotificationsEventDispatcher.handleEvent(NotificationsEventDispatcher.java:58)
  at sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor190.invoke(Unknown Source)
  at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
  at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:497)
  at com.atlassian.event.internal.SingleParameterMethodListenerInvoker.invoke(SingleParameterMethodListenerInvoker.java:36)
  at com.atlassian.event.internal.AsynchronousAbleEventDispatcher$1$1.run(AsynchronousAbleEventDispatcher.java:48)
  at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1142)
  at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:617)
  at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)
{noformat}

fields.description:
We are using Confluence 5.5.3, with User directory link to AD via Crowd Server as the second User Directory, Confluence Internal Directory is the first one.

confluence-administrators is NOT a group in our AD. So it should be internal Confluence's group. I'm the only user in the confluence-administrators group by now, maybe because I was the one who installed confluence.
Now when I want to add another user into this group, as a back up admin, confluence doesn't report any error, but no new account was added.

I went to Cog -> User Management, and on the left side bar clicked on Groups.
In the Find Group box, I typed in confluence-administrators, found the group and clicked on it.
From this group's page, I saw only my account there. 
I clicked on Add Member, and either typed in the new account name from AD directory, or clicked the search icon to find the new account I wanted to add. then clicked Add.
The screen went back to the Group members: confluence-administrators page, but no new name was added.

I found the error in atlassian-confluence.log
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Caused by: com.atlassian.crowd.exception.ApplicationPermissionException: Group 'confluence-administrators' does not exist in the directory of the user and cannot be added.
	at com.atlassian.crowd.manager.application.ApplicationServiceGeneric.ensureGroupExistsInDirectory(ApplicationServiceGeneric.java:1214)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.manager.application.ApplicationServiceGeneric.addUserToGroup(ApplicationServiceGeneric.java:1115)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.embedded.core.CrowdServiceImpl.addUserToGroup(CrowdServiceImpl.java:710)
	... 327 more
2015-04-07 10:42:22,137 INFO [read-only-transaction:thread-1] [atlassian.confluence.user.DefaultUserAccessor] getUserNamesWithConfluenceAccess Could not find group configured with USE permission: Engg IT Admin
2015-04-07 10:42:22,137 INFO [read-only-transaction:thread-1] [atlassian.confluence.user.DefaultUserAccessor] getUserNamesWithConfluenceAccess Could not find group configured with USE permission: Dell Networking
2015-04-07 17:47:33,689 WARN [AtlassianEvent::CustomizableThreadFactory-1] [confluence.mail.notification.DefaultNotificationsSender] call Send Notification: Not sending email [ Development Operations > NEXTGENDBs For ORACLE ] to [ Hung Nguyen ]:  No email set
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Why the add member action tried to find confluence-administrators group in crowd and not in internal directory first?
Can we add a user's AD account into internal directory?

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-37156].
  {panel}

Currently the versions of a page do not reflect the included version of attachments in the page. When looking at older version of a page, attachment are always referenced as latest version. 

*Request:*

When including or linking an attachment in a page the version of the attachment should be referenced in the page. As soon as a newer version of an attachment is added, the version of the page should also reflect this. 

This enables workflows to easily work for attachment approvals. It might also help enterprise customers to move from classic document-management (e.g. Sharepoint) to a compliant web-based document-control, not only referring an approved office document within a page, but the complete confluence page as compliant document.

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-37149].
  {panel}

it is common to have a failed data point in a chart, but the chart macro does not do anything sensible when it encounters this.  For instance if you had a table like with this data:

||H1||H2||
|1|1|
|2|2|
|3|3|
|4| |
|5|5|

you'd end up with the chart macro recording the 4th charting point as a zero.  it's not a zero, it's missing.  the graph should register a blank spot not go down to zero.
fields.summary: chart macro mishandles discontinuities

fields.description:
h3. Summary
After creating a table, and merging cells in all columns except for one, adding a row actually only adds a row to the non-merged column, and not the table itself.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new page
# Add a 3 x 3 table
# Merge the 2 cells in the first column and last column leaving the middle column untouched
# Place the cursor in the first box and select *add a row*

h3. Expected Results
Expect to be able to add an un-merged (default style) row under the current row
h3. Actual Results
A row is added to the un-merged column (Middle Column) even though the cursor was not placed in the column

h3.Solution / Workaround
Un-merge the cells in the row, create a new row, then select the above cells to be merged.  Since the new row was created, new complete rows will continue to be able to be added to the table.
fields.summary: Unable to add a row to a table after merging cells

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-37141].
  {panel}

The {{code}} macro in confluence allows to highlight many languages and is quite useful, but often I've found that I need to describe bash shell sessions in confluence. 

The closest highlighter that Confluence has for this is _bash_, but it interprets all of the lines as shell script and can not be used to show output from a shell session in the code block.

Ideally, the shell session highlighter would only treat lines starting with {{#}}, {{$}}, {{>}} or _{{user@linuxbox}}_ (or anything that looks like a command prompt) as code and all the rest as comments or output.

There's pretty good overview of different highlighting options and their expected effects in this [Pygments shell-session lexer demo|https://bitbucket.org/christianjann/pygments-shell-session-lexer-demo] (or just see the[ comparison of different "modes" of highlighting|http://jann.cc/pygments-shell-session-lexer-demo/shell_code_comparison.html]).
fields.summary: Add support for shell session highlighting in Confluence

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-37135].
  {panel}

Quite often when troubleshooting, the Confluence logs can be inundated with errors to the point where its not possible to distinguish events. 

Additionally, repeating errors have the side effect of making the logs roll, which means we can't go back a day or so. In those cases, we typically do a "wait and see" while we keep our ear to the ground. 

Suggested log structure for Confluence Cloud to help alleviate said conditions above: 

*Confluence logging:*
/service/j2ee_confluence/log/main/confluence

*Mail logging:*
/service/j2ee_confluence/log/main/mail

_Add-On logging (would be specific to customer):_

*Team Calendars:*
/service/j2ee_confluence/log/main/teamcal

*Gliffy:*
/service/j2ee_confluence/log/main/gliffy

*Questions*
/service/j2ee_confluence/log/main/questions

Etc.
fields.summary: Parse Confluence logs into subfolders

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-37134].
  {panel}

I would like to be able to create a report which only shows tasks which are due by a certain date:

duedate <= dueDateTo

 It should be possible to specify dueDateTo as a specific value, or a rolling value of x days in the future/past:

tasks due this week: duedate <= +7d
tasks overdue by 3 days: duedate <= -3d

It should be possible to specify whether tasks with no due date are included or excluded:

tasks possibly due this week: duedate <= +7d include (i.e. duedate <= +7d OR duedate == null)
tasks definitely due this week: duedate <= +7d exclude
fields.summary: Task report macro - filter by due date

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-37132].
  {panel}

*Symptom*
Task Report and Task Tab in People Page give wrong URL of the pages, and "Page Not Found" is shown when clicked. It happens only when page titles contains non-alphanumeric characters (not a pretty URL).

*Steps to reproduce*
# Login to Confluence
# Create a page with a title containing non-alphanumeric characters (has some tasks inside).
# Go to "Tasks" in my page (<CONFLUENCE_URL>/plugins/inlinetasks/mytasks.action)
# Click the link on "Tasks appear on" column

*Finding*
Such links contain two question marks (please see TheProblem.jpg)

*Workaround*
Manually replace the second question mark to an ampersand. For example:
- Before: https://<SUBDOMAIN>.atlassian.net/wiki/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=4489219?focusedTaskId=1
- After: https://<SUBDOMAIN>.atlassian.net/wiki/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=4489219&focusedTaskId=1
fields.summary: Wrong URL on Task Report and Task Tab in People Page, Returns Page not Found

fields.description:
*Finding*
Long sentence with single and double byte characters gets line break between single byte word and double byte character as attached (TheProblem.jpg). I tried to solve the problem by making use of [PDF Stylesheet|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Customising+Exports+to+PDF], but in vain.

*Workaround*
There are two workarounds that I have found so far:
- Embrace single byte phrase with <span> tag by using [Confluence Source Editor|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.editor.confluence-source-editor] (See workaround.jpg)
- Export to Word and covert the Word document to PDF

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-37124].
  {panel}

Hi,

Currently roadmap planner places bars roughly. The ability to define and display the start and end date for bars would help having a clear description of timing.

Including [~D Monaghan] comments, the goal of this improvement would be to :
- add an option "Start date" with a calendar. 
- add an option "End date" with a calendar. 
- add an option "Selected lane"
- once modifications are validated by the user, the bar move to it's lane and size according to specified parameters
- when the user move or change the size of the bar manually (using drag & drop) the dates are updated accordingly
- when the user change the lane of a bar manually (using drag & drop), the selected lane value is updated accordingly
- add an option to display Start and End dates on the roadmap planner ?

for markers :
- Add an option "Date" with a calendar
- Add a tick box "Today" which grays the "Date" parameter
- once modifications are validated by User, the marker is moved accordingly on the planning

Regards
Nicolas
fields.summary: [Roadmap Planner] Option to display start/end dates in bars

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-37123].
{panel}
h3. Summary

Images are not included in the PDF Export of Jira cases embedded in a confluence page using the Jira Issue/Filter macro.
h3. Steps to replicate:
 # Create a new Bug in Jira
 # Attach an image to the Jira Bug and embed in the Description field
 # Create a new page in confluence
 # Add JIRA Issue/Filter macro to the page and configure the filter to include the Jira Bug and display Description field.
 # Save page
 # Select Export to PDF

h3. Expected Behaviour

Image from the Jira Bug should be included in the PDF
h3. Actual Behaviour

The image isn't included in the PDF. The rest of the description text looks as expected
h3. Workarounds

(Submitted by customers in the comments)
h5. Workaround 1 - Using CSS
 # Add CSS in an HTML macro to clean up the formatting.  I have used the 'Include Page' macro so that this html code is in a template page and can be easily added to any page that will be exported.  I used the following CSS code (note: I have no experience with CSS so if anyone can clean this up, please advise):
 ## table.aui, td, th \{border-bottom: 1px solid lightgrey;padding: 10px;vertical-align:top;}
 ### Formats the JIRA tables similar to how they appear in Confluence.
 ## table \{border-collapse: collapse;}
 ### Single line table border (I don't know if this one is needed)
 ## table.aui \{width:100%;}
 ### JIRA tables stretch the full page width like in Confluence
 ## h1 \{padding-top:12px;padding-bottom:6px;}
 ### Spacing around headers
 ## h2 \{padding-top:6px;padding-bottom:3px;}
 ### Spacing around headers
 ## div.pageSection.group:not(#comments-section)\{display: none;}
 ### Hide attachments section which is shown during HTML export
 ## #footer-logo \{display:none;}
 ### Hides an Atlassian logo that overlaps another Atlassian logo
 # Export HTML
 ## Space Tools -> Content Tools -> Export -> HTML -> Custom Export
 ## Select the relevant page and export
 # Save as PDF (I used Chrome)

h5. Workaround 2 - Editing hosts file

The workaround was to add the proxy to the hosts file in 127.0.0.1, this fixed the PDF issues, I also have the Word issue, this might be due to other macros/plugin content or scripts in the page, go ahead and create a simple page with content and images, it will be able to download the Word document, the problem for me is the extra macros and template changes (theme customization plugin).

127.0.0.1 jira.yourdomain.com
h3. Notes

(Submitted by a customer in the comments)
 # Confluence doesn't seem to be able to export ANY image that is hosted locally.
 # Confluence correctly generates the URLs to the images and these URLs are accessible just fine. However, Confluence seems to think, that the images are available on the local file system rather than using an HTTP download. (There seems to be either a DownloadResourceManager missing or the URLs are wrongly interpreted to use the IconDownloadResourceManager)

fields.description:
I had a couple tasks on pages which I deleted instead of checking off because I assumed that deleting them would remove them from my tasks list, or mark them as complete there. However, they still show up in my tasks list. I reverted one of the pages, marked the task complete, saved the page, then deleted the task from the page, but now I have an additional, duplicate incomplete task in my task list. When I try to check them off in my tasks list, I get a red error message that says, "Oops! Your task change couldn't be saved. There could be a few reasons for this." I imagine this is because they no longer exist on those pages so those pages are not able to be updated.

I would like tasks that have been deleted not to show up in my list of incomplete tasks, regardless of whether they have been deleted or not.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-37109].
  {panel}

When an unsupported file type is attached to a page, clicking on a link attempts to preview the file, with an error message "This file cannot be previewed". Prior to 5.7, these files would simply be downloaded. Now, users get an extra pop up which may be confusing. Users can still download the file from the top right corner overlay, but may not remember to do so.

There are a few points concerning this file preview:
# If the file can't be previewed (and we should have a good idea based on it's mime type and extension), why do we not just allow the file to download?
# If we can't preview the file, the message that states the file cannot be previewed should help the user to an alternate action - in this case, to download the file. Either a direct link or a guide to the download icon in the top right corner to foster the correct behavior. The current preview window relies on the user knowing the behavior of this window, which may not be 100% concrete so soon after an upgrade

Alternatively, it would be awesome if an administrator could control what file types are attempted to be previewed or not. If for example, we add the ability to preview visio files, and a company with large visio files may not want them previewed in their instance, they should have the ability to disable previews for a certain file type - and just allow the file to be downloaded.
fields.summary: The new files preview presents unsupported file types in an unfriendly fashion.

fields.description:
h6. Steps to reproduce:
# Create two user in Confluence:
## User1
## User2
# Create a space - remove group permissions, and ensure two users can access the space 
# Add User 2 as a watcher for the space home page. Add a comment to the page, and verify user 2 gets a notification in their workbox.
# Now, remove user 2 from space permissions, add another comment to the page, and see if user 2 gets another notification in their workbox.

h6. Expected Behavior:
User 2 shouldn't get notification while he/she doesn't have permission on that space.
h6. Actual Behavior:
User 2 is getting notification in the workbox.

h6. Workaround 1:
Space admin can go through the individual pages and remove the user 2 from the manage watchers:
Watch > Manage Watchers
(i) It's good if that space doesn't have many pages.

h6. Workaround 2:

*Step 1*: Check if following query has a result:
{code:sql}
SELECT n.notificationid, n.contentid, n.spaceid, um.username, c.title, s.spacename, s.spacekey
FROM notifications n
JOIN user_mapping um on n.username = um.user_key
JOIN content c on n.contentid = c.contentid
JOIN spaces s on c.spaceid = s.spaceid
WHERE um.username = 'user_name'
AND s.spacename = 'space_name'
{code}

*Step 2:* If the above query has a result then run following query:
{code:sql}
DELETE FROM notifications 
WHERE notificationid in (
        SELECT n.notificationid
        FROM notifications n
        JOIN user_mapping um on n.username = um.user_key
        JOIN content c on n.contentid = c.contentid
        JOIN spaces s on c.spaceid = s.spaceid
        WHERE um.username = 'user_name'
        AND s.spacename = 'space_name'
)
{code}

(i) Please replace {{user_name}} and {{space_name}} to affected user name and space name.

(!) *Please prepare a full database backup prior to run above queries against your database*
fields.summary: After removing the space permissions from a user, that user is still receiving notification
